alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 4:35PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN SOMERSET COUNTY THROUGH 515 PM EDT... At 434 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southwest of Somerset, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... New Centerville around 445 PM EDT. Somerset around 455 PM EDT. Meyersdale around 500 PM EDT. Berlin around 505 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Shanksville, Casselman, Rockwood, Garrett and Seven Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
